For the documentation, see the project website:
   http://deeplearning.net/software/theano/
description.originalHeader: The PyMC developers have forked Theano to a new project called Aesara that is being actively developed: https://github.com/aesara-devs/aesara

description.excerpt: It is recommended that you look at the documentation on the website, as it will be more current than the documentation included with the package.

description.excerpt:
Documentation is built into ``html/`` 
The PDF of the documentation can be found at ``html/theano.pdf``
description.originalHeader: The PyMC developers have forked Theano to a new project called Aesara that is being actively developed: https://github.com/aesara-devs/aesara

description.excerpt: Theano was a Python library that allows you to define, optimize, and evaluate mathematical expressions involving multi-dimensional arrays efficiently. It is being continued as aesara: www.github.com/pymc-devs/aesara

citation.originalHeader: The PyMC developers have forked Theano to a new project called Aesara that is being actively developed: https://github.com/aesara-devs/aesara

installation.excerpt:
To install the package, see this page:
   http://deeplearning.net/software/theano/install.html
